attributes.action: Stop premium rate mobile phone service subscriptions without confirmatory text
attributes.background: Many mobile phone users have found themselves subscribed to premium rate services which are charged to their phone bills simply because they closed an unwanted pop up advert while browsing the internet. There is no cooling off period, and usually no confirmation text so bill payer is not aware!
attributes.additional_details: To stop the charges being levied unfairly there should be a 14 day cooling off period before any service charges, secondly, as many of these services don't send a confirmation text that a subscription has been set up the mobile phone user may not know. The law must be changed to stop these unfair subscriptions and charges.

attributes.action: Increase the Teacher Training Bursuries for Core subjects and Primary Education.
attributes.background: The teacher training bursury for Biology has been slashed by £5000 since last year and is unacceptable. Biology is a core subject and should be treated with the same respect as Chemistry and Physics. To take away from the bursury will only push teachers to leave and teach abroad.
attributes.additional_details: The teacher training bursury is given to students hoping to become either primary or secondary school teachers, it is used to help pay their course fees of £9000 and their living expenses for the year as they do not recieve pay even though they will be working full time. Subjects that require specialism recieve a larger bursury. Biology is not an easy subject and is a core subject throughout young people's time In education and should be given the same bursury as chemistry and physics.

attributes.action: Make the mechanics behind weight gain and loss compulsory for secondary schools
attributes.background: 64% of the UK population is overweight/obese. Many simply don’t understand why they are obese, and thus do not have the first idea of how to combat it. Basic information such as calculating Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE) should be taught in secondary schools.
attributes.additional_details:
The average British person’s total daily energy expenditure is 2000 calories. Eating just 100 calories over this per day will lead to an average weight gain of nearly 10.5 pounds (4.7kg) a year. 100 calories is one large apple, half a plain bagel, or a packet of crisps.

Being overweight or obese is connected to many health problems, such as high blood pressure, diabetes, sleep apnoea and some cancers, as well as significantly reducing life expectancy and quality of life.

attributes.action: It should be law that the Governor of the Bank of England is a UK Citizen
attributes.background: The UK leads the world in its financial expertise, and there are UK citizens experienced in this field that could do the job, but the position is currently held by a non UK national.

attributes.action: Hold a confirmatory referendum to give clarity to the EU referendum
attributes.background:
The UK has voted to leave the EU, but it does not know what it wants or how its elected government is to put its wishes into effect.
Proposed second referendum to ask:
Are you sure?
To which answer,
Yes, leave EU at any cost,
No, remain in EU and seek changes to EU constitution
attributes.additional_details:
The UK electorate has now had the opportunity to examine the consequences of the referendum but it has had no voice in saying how the country will pursue its future foreign policy and its trading relationships.
There is anecdotal evidence that the vote was used as a protest against the current political establishment.
A second referendum, if positive, will provide political legitimacy to the current government.

attributes.action: Smoking Should be Banned on Outside Station Platforms (Especially Merseyrail)
attributes.background:
"Smoking is permitted on our surface stations" - Merseyrail.org

Merseyrail allow smoking on their surface (i.e. outside) platforms. This is a disgrace! Platforms can become very congested with people and thus causing others to inhale second-hand smoke, including children and pregnant women.
attributes.additional_details:
One might argue that smoking is okay as it is still considered outside. However on the street people have the option to cross the road or move away whereas, at a station platform passengers do not have this option and instead must inhale second-hand smoke. 

London Overground stations prohibited smoking on surface platforms. Merseyrail is clearly behind modern times. If London has adopted this policy then why hasn't Merseyrail?

It is of this author's opinion that the Health Act 2006 should be amended so that smoking should be banned on any train platforms in England.

attributes.action: Make the UK a permanent armed neutral country like Switzerland.
attributes.background: Since Switzerland became an armed neutral power in 1815 the UK has approximately been involved in 50 conflicts and lost 1,540,462 UK military and civilian life's (20 of those conflicts and 7456 lifes have been lost since WW2).
attributes.additional_details: Becoming an armed nurtality country, would still enable us to keep our armed forces and deter or counter any invasion force to the UK or any overseas British territory.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools to set up sports teams for both genders.
attributes.background:
"Rugby is for boys," "Netball is for girls." 
Gender inequality in sport exists in schools, clubs and at the elite level.
All pupils should be encouraged to take part in any sport.  How hard is it to set up a rugby team for boys and a rugby team for girls? 
You can make a change!

attributes.action: Increase Government powers over interest rates to protect savers.
attributes.background: Since 2008 the Bank of England has relentlessly cut interest rates causing savers to lose a considerable amount of income and this has now reached an unacceptable level.  At the moment, the Government has limited power over interest rates.
attributes.additional_details: This petition calls for greater Government powers of the Bank of England's interest rates, so that savers can be protected.

attributes.action: Require proposed Great Reform Bill to give Parliament a veto on terms of BREXIT.
attributes.background: A repeal bill has been proposed to enable BREXIT, as of the date BREXIT takes effect. We propose this bill contain provisions for a Parliamentary vote or referendum approving the terms of BREXIT, and that for the purposes of the Act BREXIT shall not take effect until such approval has been given.
attributes.additional_details: We the people have the undisputed right, per the 2016 referendum to leave the EU. If the terms of leaving are unacceptable, it should neither be disputed that we have the right to change our minds. While it appears the Prime Minister intents to trigger article 50 without Parliamentary consent or knowledge of a likely deal, Parliament and the people can be given a say by the mechanism described above. The Act means the proposed Great Repeal Bill referred to by Mrs May in Conference on 02/10/2016.

attributes.action: All cyclists to have a basic third party insurance cover.
attributes.background: There are more and more people using bicycles these days and accidents happen. So what happens when a cyclist hits you or your vehicle and the blame is no them? Nothing because they are an uninsured vehicle, It's time for change.

attributes.action: Make it possible  to  pay a modest amount as extra tax  to fund the NHS
attributes.background: So many of us deplore the state of the health service, and the conditions in which  committed professional staff are expected to fulfil the role. Allowing individuals to commit a dedicated amount each month specifically to be spent on the NHS  could correct this .

attributes.action: Request aid from United Nations World Food Programme in reducing malnutrition
attributes.background: Documented cases of child malnutrition are increasing in deprived areas in the UK. Local authorities do not have the resources to cope, and central government funding strategies are exacerbating the situation. Outside help appears to be the only available option.

attributes.action: make it legal to revoke a step parent adoption
attributes.background:
I have parental responsibility over a child i have no actual connection with.
I feel in the long run the adoption does not benefit the child and could possibly harm them in the future when they are old enough to understand.
The situation i am in is harming my mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
I was in a same sex relationship and adopted my at the time partners child.
We are no longer together and myself and the child have no relationship.
Divorce is an option for married couples with no blood connection, step parents should also have this option when it does not harm the child.

attributes.action: Require 30% of all restaurant tips to go towards chefs
attributes.background: The chefs work as hard or maybe even more so it is only fair they get some of the tips. Seeing as most chefs earn a bit less than waiters in most places and work twice as hard at most times.
attributes.additional_details: I have worked in many kitchens where no tips have been cut and have always been unfair and so do many people. I now work in a place where the tips get cut by 40% so that the kitchen has a little extra in their pocket, and it works so great and gives us an extra goal to work towards.

attributes.action: Have urban areas hold an independence referendum on their membership in the UK
attributes.background: The social and cultural attitudes of those living in urban areas are drastically different to those of rural communities. Due to this cultural divide, having urban areas declare independence to form a Federal Urban Republic of Britain will ensure that the will of the urban population is carried out.
attributes.additional_details:
After declaring independence, we will be left with extreme border gore around the entire country. As the Federal Urban Republic of Britain, we must first form devolved parliaments, and a central parliament most likely in London. We must then negotiate our relationship with the rural areas we left behind, possibly negotiating a free movement of people agreement. It is likely that the FURB will want to stay in the EU, and so a referendum must take place to decide this.
We shall be called FURBies.

attributes.action: Increase taxes and ring-fence the income for the NHS
attributes.background: Save our NHS and Keep it free.  Increase Personal Tax by a small amount  BUT make sure the tax raised is RING FENCED to be used ONLY for NHS and Healthcare purposes.
attributes.additional_details: Many people I have suggested this to seem to think it is a good idea.

attributes.action: Make teachers do inset day training in school holidays
attributes.background: School Inset days drastically effect working families and all training should be done during school holidays so as not to effect families daily routines as well as the pupils everyday learning
attributes.additional_details: Teachers set inset days usually just after school restarts from school holidays so why can they not do them during the free 13 weeks they have each year

attributes.action: Abolish PMQs and replace with legal requirement to attend select committees.
attributes.background: PMQs no longer serve any useful constitutional purpose. The weekly event has desended into nothing more than political pantomime. Instead to enforce proper democratic accountability the PM should be obliged to attend the Home, foreign and treasury select committee for an hour each per month.

attributes.action: Amend The Equality Act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.background:
Many companies in the UK are starting to use "anti-smoking policies" that they will not hire, and even terminate an employees contract for smoking, even if they smoke off the employers premises. 
I feel as if the government should update the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.additional_details:
Over in the USA, 30 States have made  similar legislations to protect workers personal life. 
If we amend the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle/personal life's of workers, this will include a lot of lifestyle choices, Anything from smoking to being vegan. It's ridiculous that some companies won't employ smokers. Why should a business go out of its way to not employ someone who smokes which is a personal choice, even if the employee agrees to smoke off premises?.

attributes.action: Introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for zero hours contracts
attributes.background:
We call on the government to introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for hours worked above contract hours. This would set a higher minimum pay rate for zero hour/minimal hours contracts.

Hours worked above contracted hours the minimum pay rate must be at least 1.25 times the minimum wage.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this bill is to target employers who systemically provide employees with contracts for considerably fewer hours than they would normally be expected to work. The most extreme case of this is employers who widely use zero hours contracts.

In the example of a zero hours contract the minimum pay rate would be £9 per hour based on the current National Living Wage of £7.20. The same minimum rate would apply to other overtime.

attributes.action: Greater emphasis of nutrition & health education within the National Curriculum
attributes.background: Good nutrition is essential to optimise growth and development, and for the general well-being of all people. It should be a priority within the N.C in light of increasing rates of obesity, diabetes, cancer and other conditions. A large percentage of the population are uneducated on nutrition.
attributes.additional_details: Health education should be a core principle within the curriculum. Starting from KS1, children should learn the importance of food and how to cook simple receipes. Throughout the stages, students should learn how to cook a variety of healthy dishes, the importance of macro and micro nutrients, physiological and psychological impacts, body measurements, dietetics, metabolism etc. This should come within education. Many families/homes are now uneducated in this and heavily rely on processed foods.

attributes.action: Give college/sixth form students loans just like university students
attributes.background: Many people can not attend college sometimes due to not being able to afford things like the bus or metro, and not everybody is eligible for the bursary. However, the bursary is not enough for some people, for example £14 a week can not cover a £20 weekly bus pass.
attributes.additional_details: In addition, many students struggle to buy things such as notebooks and pens and textbooks needed to study. How is it fair that uni students can get loans yet we can't? We would pay it back once we completed studies and got jobs; it's very hard for a 16/17 year old to get a job these days especially without experience. It is very hard to get a job to support ourselves whilst studying a levels- it is simply too stressful which could effect our results and futures.

attributes.action: Ask the Government to issue a medal to the wounded military serving personnel.
attributes.background: Unlike the United States who issue the Purple Heart Medal, the British Armed Services do not recognize the sacrifices made by those who serve and are wounded or killed during their service by way of a special medal. We believe it is shameful that such a medal does not exist and needs to be rectified
attributes.additional_details: We ask the British Government to create a special medal to be awarded to servicemen and servicewomen who, while serving under competent authority in any capacity with one of the UK Armed Forces has been wounded or killed. We also ask that the Government consider that this medal be posthumously awarded to qualifying servicemen and servicewomen who have been wounded or killed since the 28th July 1914.

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find £8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over £10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: Provide income tax relief and remove insurance premium tax on health insurance.
attributes.background: The affordability and rapid uptake in the number of individuals and employing organisations taking out private health insurance across the uk would immediately ease the current pressure on the NHS. There would also be a rapid growth of private sector health care in the uk providing economic benefit.
attributes.additional_details: There is currently no financial incentive for individuals or organisations to take out private health care insurance.The NHS is left to pick up all the workloads and costs of large numbers of the uk population who would by choice move into private sector health care provision if the cost of premiums were lowered by incentives. This would rapidly reduce the demand on NHS services across the uk now and for the foreseeable future and stimulate growth and investment in private health care provision.

attributes.action: Ban the testing of joined up handwriting in primary school SAT's.
attributes.background: There is currently an epidemic of illegible handwriting in our secondary schools. Primary schools have been forced to cut corners, using a continuous cursive method from Reception to simply tick the boxes of the handwriting statements in the Interim Teacher Assessment Framework.
attributes.additional_details: There is no long term benefit to this; it is simply to meet the Interim Teacher Assessment Framework handwriting statements, which contradicts the handwriting statements in the current National Curriculum. Also, we believe that it should be a statutory requirement that left handed pupils receive specific teaching to meet their needs, to help them master legible handwriting and continue to love writing.

attributes.action: Make schools have nit nurses back and children with lice stay home.
attributes.background: Are you sick and tired of your children getting headlice because parents are forced to send their children to school with headlice, as schools see education been more important than health? I certainly am. Help to get nit nurses back into schools.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents of children with headlice are been harrassed to send their children to school and the spread of lice continues. 
They think if a childs hair is tied up they can not be spread. Wrong.
They think as long as your actively trying to get rid of them, the child should be in school. Wrong.
Children with headlice should be kept off school until the headlice are completely gone and the nit nurse should be able to check before allowing a child back into school. 
A once a week visit would sufice.

attributes.action: GCSE students should study their chosen subject from year 8.
attributes.background: I believe studying a GCSE is incredibly hard from personal experience, I have found that learning and subject for less that 2 years at GCSE isn't very usefully as it's hard to lear alll the content I believe that from year 8 we should start doing GCSE work because it would alllow for more practice.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, students would be benefited from this because their work would actually be at use by the time exams come around. Learning for year 8 would allow year 7 to be a year where you deciede what subjects you want to take at GCSE and with 4 years of learning this would allow students to possibly take on more GCSEs due to the increased learning time.

attributes.action: Make Ofsted Inspections in Schools a regular, unexpected thing without knowing
attributes.background: Teachers change how they teach and behave when ofsted are at the school. I think that ofsted should be unexpected and should be a last minute thing for teachers to know.

attributes.action: Give early years teachers (with EYTS) the same rights for pay as those with QTS.
attributes.background: EYTs have to pass the same skills test and interviews to qualify onto the course, and meet and pass against the same amount of standards and assessments as those with QTS. Therefore rights for starting pay should be the same, and the professionalism of the early years should be further recognised.
attributes.additional_details: Get into teaching (https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-and-salary/teacher-salaries) states 'As a newly qualified teacher you’ll begin on a salary of at least £22,467, or £28,098 in inner London. As you rise up the pay ranges, you could earn as much as £115,582 as a head...' However on the same web page it states an unqualified teacher can receive a minimum of £16,461. Early Years Teachers are currently viewed as 'unqualified' despite the vigorous post graduate year training.

attributes.action: A referendum to stop HS2 & spend the money on more appropriate things.
attributes.background: The previous Labour Gov't and subsequent administrations are grandstanding to create a new railway, which will make the journey between London and Birmingham 20 minutes shorter. This will destroy so many pretty villages and people's homes & at present is estimated to cost between £50 & £80 billion.
attributes.additional_details: This is not the 19th century where our Victorian forbears really were innovative and had great reasons to build. They were investing in the great Industrial revolution for it to work then and there. The HS2 project will come to "fruition" in 30 years time and by that time, it is very possible it will be out of date. Businessmen can work on trains and often this journey is beneficial to a meeting. Cutting the journey time by 20 minutes is a false economy, whilst so many other projects need funds.

attributes.action: Allow town councils to set their own business rates
attributes.background: Small towns across the U.K. Are suffering from empty shops due in part to excessive business rates. These rates should be set locally and councils should be able to suspend temporarily in order to boast local business.
attributes.additional_details: Currently rates are set by the valuation office. They need to be set locally based on requirements and economic growth.

attributes.action: Support Community Radio/Media organisations with a substantive funding increase.
attributes.background: There are now over 240 Ofcom licensed Community Radio/Media organisations across the UK, many of whom are struggling and increasingly having to commercialise their operations to survive, against the spirit and original intent of Community Radio since inception in 2002/04. http://tiny.cc/comradiofund
attributes.additional_details: In addition to a substantive funding increase, a relaxation in the associated constraints on Community Radio Fund grant use (ie. what it can and cannot be spent on) is also sought. http://tiny.cc/comradiofund

attributes.action: Reform the law to secure greater equality for transgender and non-binary people
attributes.background:
Trans and non-binary people face inequality in the law and unacceptable levels of discrimination in society. 

The UK government must reform the law to extend discrimination protections, improve gender recognition rights, and give the Scottish Parliament powers to protect & extend LGBTI equality.
attributes.additional_details:
Specifically this petition calls on the UK government to:
 
• Update the Equality Act 2010 to ensure all trans and non-binary people are fully protected from discrimination.
 
• Reform the Gender Recognition Act 2004 in line with international best practice, and scrap the spousal veto, to ensure all trans and non-binary people are able to access their human right to legal gender recognition.
 
• Devolve equality law to Scotland so the Scottish Parliament can protect and extend LGBTI equality.

attributes.action: TAX non-reusable sanitary products & give out free reusable pads, cups & nappies
attributes.background:
'Disposable' items such as tampon applicators and wipes pollute our beaches, end up in landfill, and Kill wildlife.
With the revenue generated from the TAX, give out free reusable pads, cups and nappies.
If there is any money leftover this should go towards cleaning the UK coasts of rubbish.
attributes.additional_details:
www.facebook.com/keeptampontax/

https://www.theguardian.com/vital-signs/2015/feb/12/science-plastic-oceans-study-fish-pollution-worse

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/21/flushing-tampons-toilet-blocks-drains-sanitary-products

attributes.action: A better awareness of endometriosis within NHS and treatments available.
attributes.background: It can take years to diagnose condition, lack of understanding and knowledge within communities, more information and support available for sufferers, it may not be cancer but this is a slow crippling disease affecting your body and mind.

attributes.action: To debate the political impartiality of the Speaker of the House of Commons.
attributes.background: The Speaker of the House of Commons is meant to be impartial. Our Parliament successfully functions because of a set of values, rules and processes. Infringing these rules undermines Parliamentary Democracy and the Institution of Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: MPs should consider the Speakers' recently expressed opinion on foreign policy matters, particularly his hostile position to a US Presidential address and his welcoming stance in relation to countries with a history of human rights abuse including China, Singapore, Indonesia and Kuwait. His inconsistent tolerance of applause in the Commons (acceptable at the end of his own speech and not at the end of SNP speeches) should also be considered.

attributes.action: To put extra funding into the NHS .
attributes.background:
We all know about the plight of the NHS , stop using it as a political football , too many Governments past and present have failed the NHS .
At least bring us into line with other European countries as far as funding goes.
Suspend foreign aid or increase Income Tax and N.I. Contributions.

attributes.action: Institute a Parliamentary medal  for an  historic contribution to  democracy
attributes.background:
This award will be specifically for contributions to parliamentary democracy as distinct from other types of contributions to public life or to the work of the government or the crown.

 The model should be the Congressional Gold Medal of the United States
attributes.additional_details: For example without the actions of a private citizen Gina Miller  Article 50 would not have been debated in parliament. Gina a private citizen lead a movement resulting in  a historic Supreme Court judgement which will resound down the ages and clarify  the balance of power between parliament and the government. Such a historic contribution to parliamentary democracy should be recognised by the Gold Medal.

attributes.action: Make labelling GMO foods mandatory.
attributes.background: It is still unsure as to the health effects of Genetically Modified Organism's and there is evidence to support the unsustainablility of GMO's in future agriculture.

attributes.action: Make it law all cars sold  that the driving licence Number of new keeper ON V5
attributes.background: Having a spate of cars bought buy people to use as pool cars for crime and possible have no licence causing havoc in the communites of the UK
attributes.additional_details: Having a spate of cars bought buy people to use as pool cars for crime and possible have no licence causing havoc in the community. Seems selling to anyone with out a licence or the person having no conscious of there actions for a quick turn around of money these cars having no mot with many defects tax or insurance

attributes.action: Force Councils to fix the roads throughout England
attributes.background: Within the Northwest alone roads are dangerous cars are avoiding pot holes which in turn could result in a possibly fatal accident. Not only only is this unsafe the overall cost could potentially be higher than if the councils hired someone to fix the roads.
attributes.additional_details: Manchester roads have deep visible cracks which could result in a sink hole, Rochdale roads have potholes inches deep, something needs to be done before an accident occurs.

attributes.action: Make it that child maintenance payments come with visitation rights.
attributes.background: I pay maintenance for my children but still get stopped from seeing them. If the other parent takes payment from you you are entitled to see them without a court order if you are stopped from seeing them then payments should be reduced

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: When my fiancé takes out our kids and they just have male/female toilets, there are no baby change facilities in the male toilets! He either has to use the floor or do it in the car which isnt ideal. There are so many more involved dads nowadays, we need to make things more accessible for them too!

attributes.action: Stop university grants to be given based on household income in The UK.
attributes.background:
I find it unlawful for the government to think that there is a correlation between University funding and a household income.

A huge majority will have no financial help from these 'dependant people'.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this petition is to make the system that is already in place fairer for everyone.

People that want to go to university but won't receive help from these 'dependant people' (from the household income system in place) should not be left short and left to struggle.

attributes.action: Action by parliament to stop the proliferation of graffiti in towns and cities.
attributes.background: Graffiti on buildings Is endemic throughout the UK. Measures should be place to stop this anti social practice and clean up the mess created. This should involve hefty fines, community service to remove graffiti and imprisonment for repeat offenders.

attributes.action: Make it so students can choose a certain method for exams.
attributes.background: Make it so that students can take one of four options for exams at A-level and GCSE: Written, Vocal, Coursework base or practical in as many subjects as possible and the student can decide what type of examination method they want to be tested by.

attributes.action: Revoke requiring military personnel to swear Oath to the Monarchy & God.
attributes.background:
I considered joining the Navy Reserves until I discovered you are required to swear and Oath of Alliegence to the Monarch and God. 
I feel this shouldn't be in place as it can prevent people from wanting to join. An oath to the Monarchy and religious beliefs should not interfere with service.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oath_of_Allegiance_(United_Kingdom)#Armed_forces

attributes.action: Lower university fees down to £3,000 as they were before 2012.
attributes.background: People want to access further education but don't have the necessary funds to support themselves. By lowering the fees students will not leave university with crippling debts.
